intro: Cahota, commonly known as the yellow balsa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palm-like appearance with large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its roots are fibrous and can be used in traditional medicine. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight.
